meanings.definition: falterers: those who hesitate or waver in action or belief
meanings.sent1: The falterers at the edge of the cliff were afraid to take the next step.
meanings.sent2: The group of falterers couldn't decide on a plan for the project.
meanings.sent3: The falterers in the race kept looking back, unsure if they should continue.
meanings.sent4: The falterers in the debate struggled to make a firm point.
meanings.sent5: The falterers in the crowd stood still, uncertain of which direction to go.

meanings.definition: falterers: to hesitate or stumble in speech or movement
meanings.sent1: She falterers when speaking in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent2: He falterers while trying to walk on the icy sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The comedian intentionally falterers during his act to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dancer gracefully avoids falterers during her performance.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice never falterers, even during emotional songs.
